benchmark_details.name: TheoremExplainBench
benchmark_details.overview: TheoremExplainBench is a benchmark covering 240 theorems across multiple STEM disciplines, designed to evaluate multimodal theorem explanations generated by AI, specifically in the context of theorem understanding and reasoning through video explanations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized evaluation framework for AI-generated video explanations of theorems.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Visual structuring challenges and inconsistent retrieval-augmented generation impact quality.

data.source: Curated from various STEM disciplines, including Computer Science, Chemistry, Mathematics, and Physics.
data.annotation: Automated metrics with human evaluation components.

methodology.calculation: Scores are computed based on various dimensions of evaluation metrics.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better accuracy, logical flow, and visual engagement.
methodology.validation: Performance is validated through human evaluations and comparisons with human-made videos.
